review: I was excited about this but it really is a piece of crap. I got it, plugged it in (yes the power cord is in a horrible place and required) it wasn't configured to my account as promised. I tried to get it set up on my own and no luck. I called Amazon and was told it was a known issue and will be fixed in 24 hours. I called back after a few hours and was told there was no known issue and after 1.5 hours on the phone they got it registered. I enjoyed it for a week and after watching a movie on Prime I went to find another and poof...no network. Mind you my other 8 devices are on it fine but not the Fire Stick. I put in my credentials again....that's all you can do...and nothing. Just get a Roku and be happy with a proven product. I have twice in less than a week unplugged my Fire Stick and put my Roku back in. It really is worthless, which is a shame because I like Amazon. I guess they need to get out of the hardware business.
author: Amazon Customer

review: This is a must have for any Amazon Prime member.  The stick is not as good as the FireTV box but it is very close.  I have the FireTV box in my living room and put the FireTV Stick in the bedroom and will use the stick when travelling.  It was really easy to set up and the voice app on the phone/tablet works great.  The remote that is included works just fine too!I have the HBO Go app on my Kindle tablet and phone, so no reason to believe the app won't be made available soon for the FireTV lineup.  I heard it may be by the end of December 2014.Again, it's a no brainer if you're a Prime member and if you're not it is a good entry device into streaming media players and it gives you a free month of Prime to start.
author: My $0.02

review: The product is super easy to set up; but from there it just gets bad.  You have to wait about ten minutes for the stick to do an upgrade.  Then a video is shown on how to use the system.  I am trying to watch Hulu and the stick is having so many issues streaming.  The screen is freezing, goes blank, only audio works and on and on.  And yes, it is plugged into the wall.  I think I am going to stick with a roku box for permanent ideas.  Im just not sure this product was ready for market.
author: Danielle

review: This product clearly has some weird issues with HDMI connectivity.  After plugging into my AVR,  it must have tried to configure CEC, and in doing so, shut down my TV and when the TV was powered back on, I had an error I had never heard of before.It literally takes a power cycle of the fire stick for video to be displayed.
author: Todd Brust

review: Finally a competitor for the Roku. I have this on my non-smart TV and it fills a gap in my entertainment. The ability to use a remote has turned into a real plus. I also have a Chromecast and get tired of having to use my phone to control the TV. If i want to use my phone there is an app for that. For Prime Members this is a must have. You get access to all  your Music, Photos, Apps, and Prime Movies. Not sure how useful it is for games, but it does that too.  the faster processor is pretty notable, and it responds immediately to any command. Big plus i have found is the 5GHz support to clear up the 2.4 for other things. A recent update fixed the Display Mirroring for Windows 8.1 and now I can mirror the display on my Surface 3, but this is display only not audio (like AirPlay)
author: jedi-mykal "jedi-mykal"

review: For whatever reason, I have to unplug and reset all my cable boxes every time I have this plugged in.  It's not rocket science, I plug it into an unused HDMI port on my TV and my cable box will stop displaying video on the TV until I unplug and reset every box in the house.  This has happened multiple times.(Scratches head)

review: Update 2More disappointments :- Memory is only 5.57 GB vs advertised 8 GB- Wifi keeps getting disconnected.- Apps takes forever to load .- Display is blurry for a while after the app loads- I tried updating the software but it just displays "Checking now" and then get disconnected.PS  : I have a 20 MBPS internet connection, so slow internet speed is not the issue either.------The device should have come pre-registered as mentioned on box. The sign-in keep getting failed and after troubleshooting with tech support for half an hour , I was able to get it registered.PROS-Good for prime users.Picture quality is good.CONS/Disappointments -1) USB wire is too long and keeps dangling if connected to TV's USB port. Chromecast has perfect length USB cable.The image under the Technical details page gives a wrong impression that the stick can be used without connecting to power adaptor or the usb cable.2) Amazon fire TV app doesn't work as advertised. I confirmed the android version, it is above 4.0 and I also confirmed both phone and fire stick were on same wifi network. The app keep searching for Fire TV devices and nothing shows up.The circle on the remote appears as though you can scroll similar to an ipod but it is a push-click button.
